Reviews.Title: “Eur Suite...not so sweet!”
Reviews.Author: dmkresge
Reviews.Content: Didn't find a helpful front desk upon arrival. Rooms were clean and neat, but no frills to speak of. We were only there 2 nights so it was fine. Breakfast left alot to be desired. There was a tour group there, so all the food was pretty much gone. We had to ask for them to refill the food so others can eat. Not located in a good place. We had to take a bus, then 2 metros to get to any tourist places in Rome. Next time I would spend a little more and stay more locally then deal with nasty bus drivers every day.

Reviews.Title: “less than respect”
Reviews.Author: cozy1001
Reviews.Content: First, I think this is four star hotel, but the room is not nice and clean at all. I think they should take "suite" off. They not reserve. the wifi is unusable at all. only breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel itself was fine, but if we had a do-over, we'd pick something closer to the center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Danielle D
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't call this a four-star hotel, however it was nice, clean, and quiet and we enjoyed our stay. All the people working at the front desk were nice and accommodating, and the night bartenders were friendly and helpful as well. The rooms are large and the bathroom is well set up with the vanity separate from the bath/toilet. We found the location just too far away from the action to be convenient. After our first trip on the bus/metro (for us was quite confusing...) we found it would just be much easier to rent a scooter so that we could do things on our own schedule. The breakfast was delicious with tons of options, which is a good thing, because you will want to eat it-- otherwise you will be starving by the time you get to Rome's center. Overall the only thing we disliked, other than the location, was that getting WiFi is ridiculously expensive at the hotel and there was no inexpensive options in the immediate area that we could find. Otherwise, a great hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: lth1031NewYork
Reviews.Content: I flew into Rome's Fiumicino - Leonardo da Vinci airport and stayed at this hotel for 3 nights (march 6-9, 2012). I went the Tourist information center at the airport and purchased a Roma Pass there. If you plan on visiting many museums and using the bus/Metro system, I highly recommend getting a Roma Pass. At the airport there's a bus that takes to you Rome's city center (right near the Termini Station) for 4 or 6 euros (i can't remember but it's the cheapest way to get into the center). It's a good hotel in the E.U.R. district of Rome (however, it is pretty far from city center where all the cites were). You can take the B line to Laurentina (it's the last stop on the train). It's about a 25 minute ride from Termini stop. When you get out of the train and walk up the stairs, stay to your left. Exit thru the doors that are on your left. As you walk thru the doors, there are rows of bus spots on your left. Bus #776 will take you to the hotel. I think bus #776 is parked in slot #1. The ride on the bus is about 10-15 min. (one passenger told me that it's 6 stops away, but sometimes the bus driver doesn't stop at every stop so either ask the driver or keep your eyes on the road)! As the bus goes down the road, the hotel is on the left hand side. At night time, there are blue neon lights saying "Hotel" to help you spot it easily. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I had no problems checking in at 1:30 in the afternoon. My room was sparse, but large. My room was like the size of a little apartment in NYC. There was a living room, and when you open another door, it leads into the bedroom with twin beds. My living room had doors that opened into a little outdoors patio. It was really nice. The beds are comfortable. It was clean, and the showers had great water pressure. The bathroom was pretty large as well. Very nice hotel in Rome. There was also free breakfast in the morning (basic continental breakfast)! It's pretty close to Ostia Antica if you plan on visiting the site!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service at the front desk and the telephone”
Reviews.Author: Kary726
Reviews.Content: My family try to call me and like for 20 minutes nobody answer the phone, and finally when someone answer the phone, she was extremely unpolite and she never apologyse, she just said "what u need", so finally i just ask her the room number; then and the front desk we asked her about the roma pass and she said " i 'm sorry i don't have time now but there was noone else at the front desk. This is the trip of our lives in europe in the are giving us a bad image for tourists and i mean i am a travel agent

Reviews.Title: “Far from everything, but a nice hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: VeryCurious_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Eur Suite Hotel for one night at the beginning of October 2011. Unlike some other places we stayed at, which were apartments made into small hotel, this place was an actual hotel. We found the internet to be quite expensive (you could only get the 20-Euro-for-10-hours package). On a more positive side, the staff person downstairs was friendly and allowed us to use her computer free of charge for several minutes so that we can do a check-in for our flight! (how nice is that??) The room was clean and spacious; in fact, it was two rooms: a 'living room' and a 'bedroom'. The down side was the location of the hotel. In order to get there, you have to go to Laurentina station and then take the 776 bus (which was a little tricky as you don't really know where to get off and have to ask people on the bus). The hotel is pretty much in the middle of nowhere, so if you want to go out in the evening to eat, your only options are a small pizzeria or the hotel restaurant (we ended up choosing the hotel restaurant, which we found to be good). Also, to get to any city attractions, you would have to take the bus and then the metro. The reason we chose this location in the first place is that we naively thought it would be easier to get to the airport from there than from Termini station, for example (since it is closer on the map). We were wrong: we actually had to take the bus back to Piramide metro station and then a train to the airport (while from Termini there is a direct train). Overall, except for the location and the price of the internet, we were quite happy with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Eur Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flojoflojo1
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in the E.U.R. district of Rome. Take the B line to Laurentina, then take the 776 bus to the hotel. Room was large with free air conditioning and very clean. Service was great. Had to get an early cab to the airport and did not have any problem. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap,clean and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: dorly
Reviews.Content: Lovely staff, locations a bit out the way, but if your not shy about using public transport you'll be fine!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but beware the hidden fees...”
Reviews.Author: ladylovesrome
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Eur Suite and I was really happy overall. Spacious room, nice bathroom, lots of closet space, refrigerator, small tv, seperate living room. Great breakfast but get there early for plain croissants (versus the ones with icing on them). It was smoke-free and even had a balcony. The staff was really accomodating. The only downsides were that you can't control the temperature and they add a $18 Euro fee per person even though my trip was prepaid. $18 Euro is nearly double that US plus whatever my credit card charges so I wasn't happy about that. The location was pretty far away but fortunately, the train station is just a bus away. Don't walk to the nearby restaurants, they aren't that great. Catch the bus towards the train station and there are some cool places along the way. The kebab place and Gelatto were my favorites. There's also a grocery store across from the train station so stock up on water and fruit for the fridge :).

Reviews.Title: “BARGAIN”
Reviews.Author: perthcpl
Reviews.Content: this hotel was a bargain short drive to all historical rome. dont need public transport. when in rome park anywhere (disengaged the handbrake)

Reviews.Title: “Pure business”
Reviews.Author: sindjic
Reviews.Content: Stayed on this hotel recently to check what is a business hotel in Eternal city...SInce these are suites, it is very nice size, plenty of space and decent ammenities. One problem is the location which is by far the only downside of the venue. It is at south end of new part of Rome EUR and any ride to or from the city will take approx 1 hour. Benefit of the locaiton is relative proximity to the airports...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for car travellers, great service.”
Reviews.Author: PapezG
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel if you travel by car. It has private FREE garage, excellent staff and restaurant. Great spacious rooms. Best value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaStateFan
Reviews.Content: A group of 10 from our church were in Rome for a week and stayed at the Eur Suite Hotel. It is in a lower income area of Rome, but we were never uncomfortable. The staff was very helpful and always had someone there who was fluent in English. The rooms were the best part. Very large and spacious. All had a large living area in addition to the bedroom and bath. Air conditioning was good...sometimes you just had to ask the desk to turn it on. It was cool a day or two while we were there and they opened the windows and turned off the A/C. A refrigerator, safe, and blow dryer in each room. The buffet breakfast was acceptable, but couldn't describe it as delicious. It was exactly the same every morning. We did have dinner at the hotel one evening and it was fine, just not something to rave about. 15 euro each included water and dessert. The bus stop is just around the corner from the entrance of the hotel. Bus 776 takes you to the Laurentina metro stop which is the last stop on the line. From there it's very easy to get wherever you want to go in Rome. A week's metro pass cost 16 euro and covered the bus, metro, train, and tram. It does take 30 to 40 minutes to get to the tourist areas, including waiting on the bus. We never waited over 20 minutes for the bus. One day we were short on time to catch a tour and we took 2 taxis (5 in each taxi) . It cost us 36 euro per taxi to go to the Vatican area.

Reviews.Title: “Truly excellent rooms for the money, the rest sucks”
Reviews.Author: Waldo009
Reviews.Content: If you are only staying one or two days in Rome keep in mind that it will take you about 45 minutes to get into the city centre by public transport! Take bus 669 to the subway station. Its the last stop so it will than take you 20-25 minutes to get to the Termini where you can switch to the other subway that has the stops at the touristic neigbourhoods. The hotel is located in a dead boring residential area where you have to walk at least 10 minutes to get to a shop or restaurant. The poorly maintened hotel does not have ANY emergency lighting as we experienced during a 24 hour power breakdown! Its situated at a very quiet location. No disturbing sounds at night. The very practically furnished hotelrooms come with a lovely bathroom, and provide enough space. Theres a big fridge, but no watercooker or coffeemachine. Breakfast is so horrible that I haven't eaten during the week I was staying. There wasn't even boiling water! The airco is very effective but you cannot control it yourself so you have to ask the front desk to set the desired temperature for you. Staff was unfriendly and does not provide ANY tourist information. The information that I did get from them appeared to be inaccurate. I noticed during my stay that the hotel is very popular with Chinese tourists. The lobby and other areas like the breakfast room are very unsociable and is reminiscent of an Eastern Bloc country. If you're looking for a cozy place to meet with others or want the hotel to be centrally located in a lively neighboorhood: forget this place. If you're looking for a real low budget place where you can retreat to a comfortable hotel room: look no further, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Bad part of town”
Reviews.Author: lissylin
Reviews.Content: The Eur Suite Hotel was good for our large EF group. The kids had three to a room with room to spare. The hotel was not in a good part of town. When we were there, right across the street was a construction site. Around 6-7 you would start to hear it. It was clean. The service was okay. We had to lock our stuff up. One girl had her passport moved by a housekeeper. We had to tear the room apart looking for it. Not very good on their behave. After that we made SURE that all the kids were using the safes.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms but Watch Your Stuff!”
Reviews.Author: rodneytbond007
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Eur Suite hotel on an Ef tour as a teacher group leader and I must say that they provided spacious rooms for our students to stay in. I have traveled to Europe several times and am accustomed to smaller rooms than American and by comparison these were large but basic. The restaurant served decent food and breakfast was sufficient. (meats, cheese, breads, and good cappaccino) One thing that was not good is the location. Once you get to the hotel you can forget leaving it for anything. There is no where to go in the immediate area dn even if there was the area is like walking through the slums of America. Also, when you are in the restaurant eating watch your stuff. Italy is notorious for their pickpockets and theives and this place is not different. One of the adults that was with us had her purse swiped from the back of her chair the 2nd day we were there by two strangers who casullay came to breakfast. Having said this the hotel staff was great and we had no problems as long as we locked everything up and used the room safes. This hotel caters to student groups so dont be surprised to see people and kids roaming around all times of night. The air conditioning works well as long as you dont open the windows and the rooms are clean and fairly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Weird experience”
Reviews.Author: isj4
Reviews.Content: It started with the taxi driver exclaiming "They have put a hotel _here_?". It is not the best part of town, I must admit. I recommend taking a taxi at night. The hotel looks used, but it is clean and everything works. The room/suite was larger than my own apartment, and had working air condition; If the chef is in then the food is excellent. So the hotel is OK, but the location is not (except that it is quite near HP headquarters).

Reviews.Title: “Weird!”
Reviews.Author: The_BearLondon
Reviews.Content: Very weird hotel. For a start it's miles outside Rome on a ouncil estate. Not easy to get into city centre - bus then metro, too far in fact. Also in a rough part of town, you don't feel safe on the bus or from the bus stop to the hotel. Hotel itself OK, food very below par. Restaurant underused, in fact we were the only diners! Grim.

Reviews.Title: “Deep disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Istanbuldan
Reviews.Content: Hard to find the hotel because of bad and far location. Hotel decoration was in 60's. It's really unbelievable. Breakfast is not eatable and breakfast rooms smells heavy.Hotel staffs not friendly.Never ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel- lousy location”
Reviews.Author: lil'biffa
Reviews.Content: Eur Suite is a clean, functional hotel (nothing special) with friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are large and airy and the shower was fantastic! Sadly, the location of the hotel is in an area which is rather intimidating and as it is a long journey into Rome (Bus then Metro), we could not stay out after dark as we didn't want to be walking around the area at night with children. If you do feel brave however, the bus stop is quite close to the hotel (assuming you get off at the right one- it's easy to get lost)and busses serve the area till at least midnight. The hotel restaurant is overpriced as the standard of food is not great, which is a shame as it would be useful to have a good restaurant when you are trapped in your hotel after dark. Since there is no pool or leisure facilites and the bar is expensive it is difficult to keep children entertained on your early return to the hotel. Breakfast is ok, but not what we are used to from UK hotels- there's only so much cheese and ham a family can eat!All in all, ok if you don't mind early nights but don't go there with kids!

Reviews.Title: “Too far outside the city center”
Reviews.Author: kaceevh
Reviews.Content: Modern suite hotel, but it is just too far outside the main part of the city. In Rome, location is everything because the metro never goes where you want to go and the buses are always crowded and stop too often. If you don't mind spending most of your time traveling to and from the hotel, this is a nice hotel. Clean, modern, nice staff, decent breakfast. Huge rooms by European standards and very comfortable. But I would never stay here again simply because it is just too far out. Rome is a walking city - stay in the city center (I love to stay somewhere in the area of the Piazza Navonna and the Trevi) because from there, you can walk anywhere. If you don't like to walk, prepare to take buses or pay for taxis, and you can't hail a cab in Rome; you have to find a taxi stand and they're not on every street corner!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel grotty location”
Reviews.Author: sneeky
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my daughter. The hotel is nice, much more spacious accomodation than most within the same budget. The real drawback is the location, both a bus and a train to get to it. It is a grim area, and for two females at night I found it to be really unsettling. I would really only stay here if I was travelling with my husband. The taxis from the train station are patchy, and often you cannot get one after 9pm, so you have to take the bus. If you do not know where to get off, you are on your own, as the bus drivers proffesed not to know where it was, and if you get off at the wrong place, it is a scary area to wander round at night.

Reviews.Title: “My unexpected stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found myself at the Eur Suite Hotel quite by accident when the original hotel I had booked had a problem and had to move me elsewhere. The hotel itself was fine. It was clean and comfortable. The down-side is that it is a ten minute bus ride (776) away from Laurentina metro station, which is right at the end of Linea B of the metro system. It is in a desolate location surrounded by grotty blocks of flats and graffiti. There are no local shops or restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “About that smell”
Reviews.Author: jershu
Reviews.Content: I think that smell was dienfecatant. The rooms were very clean if not utilitarian. They could use a little more decoration. Breakfast buffet would have been great if we hadnt stayed at the Holiday Inn Express East which had a fantastic complimetary breakfast buffet . Area around the Eur Suite is a little drabby. Secure parking is a pain. You must go to front desk to get keys to get in and out of garage. but there is plenty of outdoor parking. My biggest beef was that the front desk was terrible in taking phone mesages. In fact a couple of people who tried to call us and leave meassages were not able to . Hotel is very easy to get to and from the GRA (ring road ) if you are driving.

Reviews.Title: “"no room available"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel- the manager told us that there were no rooms available- i had booked for two nights two weeks ago for Dec. 30-31. the manager kept stating that they were going to accomodate us w another room- when they showed us the room, i almost went crazy- there was a smell that i couldn;t pin point- dark- my wife and i just left to another hotel that was closer to the laurentina station- oh one other thing- the website does not tell you that you need to take a bus from the station- with waiting for the bus and traveling, it's an additional 15-20 minutes- i think that was the reason i was so pissed- the extra transportation that was not stated-

HotelInfo.Name: Eur Suite Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Prezzolini 5, 00144 Rome, Italy
